page.title: 01A first glance at Lydlinch
page.content: This area of Dorset is a typically rural one, much of the land being common and farm land.Away from the A357 and the A3030 it is very quiet,fairly open countryside, which has lost a great many of its elm trees in the last few years because of the spread of Dutch elm disease.In the hedgerows the dead trees which have not been cut down look like winter skeletons throughout the year. The River Lydden crosses the block never really becoming more than a big stream. Unless one had specific business in this area it is really only countryside that one would pass through.
